column1: Says that "A Russian drone fired from the eastern Ukrainian city of Dzhankoi, a military aircraft carrier, was caught on Friday evening. "This is a common practice that is not uncommon in the Ukrainian military, where the Ukrainian military is using such an attack to disrupt movements of Ukrainian forces in Crimea and other eastern regions of Ukraine. While the strikes are not specifically targeted, this is a sign of that tactic, and this is one of the most common ways to gain attention on the battlefield".
Kerry's statement is wrong too, his claims of missile strikes in eastern Ukraine are a result of a false or exaggerated claim about a drone strike.
Possibly Putin himself is correct, as he claimed he had no idea who the shot was from.

But the Russian official said the strike was carried out by the Ukrainian military. This is contrary to the statement, which was made by the first military commander to be mentioned by the Kremlin, and which is quite clear from the Russian military's statement. However, the Russian military's statement is a good reminder that the Russian military was not acting in a vacuum; it was acting on a genuine and credible threat from within the separatists. It is also clear from the Russian military's statement that it was not acting on a fake threat or a fake threat to Russian security.
The Russian military is not in a position to make a claim about a drone strike. It is more like a false story.
The second claim the Russian military made is that he was "not aware of any previous drone strike in Ukraine".
The second claim the Russian military made is that "he believes the strike was carried out by the Ukrainian military".
The third claim the Russian military made is that he had no idea what the source of the strike was.
The fourth claim the Russian military made is that "he was not aware of any previous drone strike in Ukraine".
